item.title:
RT by @KAndrewHuang: EXP-0003: Application Subscriptions!
In this experiment we show Porto, @ithacaxyz's Ethereum Account SDK, powering subscriptions & delegating access to your account securely.
Huge implications for app-builders doing payments/subscriptions, AI agents, Telegram bots, DeFi & more.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst

item.title:
RT by @KAndrewHuang: Today I'm joining @CooleyLLP as Special Counsel in San Francisco to support and advise founders that are forging the new tech frontier.
Building on the frontier is hard (think sectors like crypto, AI, hard tech, biotech). This is in part because the legal landscape can be complex and dynamic, making it hard to navigate.
At Paradigm, I saw many founders struggle to find the right team of lawyers to help them navigate the challenges their businesses face.
Working with crypto founders and investors on these challenges has made me uniquely equipped to help others navigate legal complexity, so they can focus on the technology they are passionate about.
But it‚Äôs not something any lawyer can tackle alone. I‚Äôve seen firsthand that Cooley is the best platform to support builders on the frontier. They are the leading law firm supporting companies in crypto, AI, biotech, and hardtech. This involves a full suite of experts in areas like securities and commodities regulation, governance, finance, hard and soft intellectual property, money transmission, and commercial transactions (just to name a few).
It‚Äôs a privilege to have the opportunity to join my good friend and former Paradigm colleague Rodrigo Seira (@RSSH273). The team at Cooley works seamlessly together to support founders on the frontier of crypto and beyond, and I‚Äôm ready to get to work.
I wouldn‚Äôt have seen this opportunity or been equipped to address it without the support of the team at Paradigm. The team at Paradigm has set the standard of how to build on the frontier of crypto and their leadership on the legal and policy front is the best in crypto.
item.dc:creator: @joshephraim
item.description:
Today I'm joining @CooleyLLP as Special Counsel in San Francisco to support and advise founders that are forging the new tech frontier.

Building on the frontier is hard (think sectors like crypto, AI, hard tech, biotech). This is in part because the legal landscape can be complex and dynamic, making it hard to navigate.

At Paradigm, I saw many founders struggle to find the right team of lawyers to help them navigate the challenges their businesses face.

Working with crypto founders and investors on these challenges has made me uniquely equipped to help others navigate legal complexity, so they can focus on the technology they are passionate about.

But it‚Äôs not something any lawyer can tackle alone. I‚Äôve seen firsthand that Cooley is the best platform to support builders on the frontier. They are the leading law firm supporting companies in crypto, AI, biotech, and hardtech. This involves a full suite of experts in areas like securities and commodities regulation, governance, finance, hard and soft intellectual property, money transmission, and commercial transactions (just to name a few).

It‚Äôs a privilege to have the opportunity to join my good friend and former Paradigm colleague Rodrigo Seira (@RSSH273). The team at Cooley works seamlessly together to support founders on the frontier of crypto and beyond, and I‚Äôm ready to get to work.

I wouldn‚Äôt have seen this opportunity or been equipped to address it without the support of the team at Paradigm. The team at Paradigm has set the standard of how to build on the frontier of crypto and their leadership on the legal and policy front is the best in crypto.

item.title:
RT by @KAndrewHuang: You can add @AcrossProtocol to your rollup on Conduit Marketplace.
Across is the pioneer of intents-based bridging, providing interoperability across 18 chains and counting ‚Äì chains like @Optimism, @Arbitrum One, @base, @zora, @modenetwork, and more.

item.title:
RT by @KAndrewHuang: Polygon PoS clocking those transactions near the top of the charts.
The step child of Ethereum who saved Ethereum from round 1 of Alt-L1 attacks. Prepping itself for third round.
via http://Rollup.wtf

item.title:
It's tempting to see @Base's success and to try and copy their strategy (modulo superficial branding)
The builder realizes that they will need to build a unique application to differentiate, and control the full-stack
item.dc:creator: @KAndrewHuang
item.description:
